name: Killer Pumpkin Pie
author: Carolynn Napoli
summary: My two boys have multiple food allergies and I wanted to try out pumpkin pie. They call this 'Killer Pumpkin Pie' because they say it tastes 'killer.' It's light and spicy and, dairy and soy free. It's fast and easy with a pressed crust which mixes in the pan.
directions: Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Stir together the flour, sugar, and salt in a 9 inch pie pan, and make a well in the center
Pour the oil and rice milk into the well, then mix with a fork until a dough forms
Use your hands to press the mixture evenly into the bottom and sides of the pan
Crimp the edge of the crust
Stir together the white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves in a large bowl; set aside
Whisk together the pumpkin puree, oil, eggs, vanilla, and rice milk in a separate bowl until evenly blended
Add the pumpkin mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until fully blended
Pour into the prepared crust and place on a cookie sheet in the preheated oven
Reduce temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean
The center may still wiggle a little but will firm up out of the oven
